skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a meta-skill for creating other skills. It includes Python utility scripts that initialize, validate, and package skill directories. The scripts create files only in user-specified paths, perform local validation, and make no network calls or system command executions. The capabilities are appropriate for the documented purpose.

content.value_statement: Creating AI skills from scratch is complex and error-prone without guidance. This skill provides a complete framework with step-by-step instructions, Python utilities for scaffolding, validation, and packaging skills for distribution.
actual_capabilities: Follow a 6-step process to create new skills from scratch
Use init_skill.py to generate skill directory structure with templates
Validate skill structure with quick_validate.py before distribution
Package skills into distributable zip files with package_skill.py
Structure skills with scripts, references, and assets directories
Apply progressive disclosure design to manage context efficiently
limitations: This skill guides skill creation but does not execute the created skills
Python scripts are helpers; users must customize generated templates
Skills created are for Claude and may not work on other AI platforms

use_cases.title: Package skills for distribution
use_cases.description: Bundle skills into zip files for sharing with teams or publishing to skill marketplaces.

use_cases.title: Create documentation skills
use_cases.description: Build skills that provide specialized knowledge bases, API references, or company policies to Claude.

use_cases.title: Develop workflow skills
use_cases.description: Create skills that encode multi-step procedures for domain-specific tasks like document processing.

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use-case]. Walk me through the 6-step skill creation process and use the init_skill.py script to scaffold the project.

prompt_templates.title: Structure resources
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a [skill-type] skill for [domain]. What scripts, references, and assets should I include? Give specific examples based on the skill anatomy guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill at [path/to/skill] using the quick_validate.py script. What validation errors need to be fixed before packaging?

prompt_templates.title: Package for release
prompt_templates.prompt: Package my skill at [path/to/skill] for distribution. Ensure validation passes and create the zip file in the ./dist directory.

output_examples.input: Help me create a document-processor skill for handling DOCX files
output: ‚Ä¢ I'll guide you through creating a document processor skill
‚Ä¢ First, let's identify concrete use cases: merge documents, extract text, add comments
‚Ä¢ Key resources to include: Python scripts for DOCX manipulation, reference docs for XML structure, template files for output
‚Ä¢ Then customize SKILL.md with workflow steps and validation

best_practices: Start with concrete user examples to define skill scope before writing content
Keep SKILL.md under 5k words and move detailed references to separate files
Validate skills with quick_validate.py before packaging for distribution
anti_patterns: Including all documentation in SKILL.md instead of using references files
Using second-person language instead of imperative/infinitive form
Skipping validation before distributing skills to users

faq.question: Can I create skills for other AI platforms besides Claude?
faq.answer: Skills follow Claude's format and may not work directly on other AI platforms. Some concepts transfer but structure is Claude-specific.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for a skill?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should stay under 5k words. Bundled resources are unlimited through scripts and assets directories.

faq.question: How do I integrate my skill with existing Claude workflows?
faq.answer: Install the skill through Claude Code's skill system. Users can combine multiple skills for complex workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Scripts run locally and only access user-specified paths. No data is sent externally or collected.

faq.question: Why does validation fail with angle brackets in description?
faq.answer: Angle brackets are blocked to prevent YAML parsing issues. Use quotes or rephrase descriptions without < or > characters.

faq.question: How does this compare to creating commands or MCPs?
faq.answer: Skills provide knowledge and workflows. Commands are single actions. MCPs integrate external services. Each serves different purposes.
